intro: Libanotis hostiana, commonly known as the European bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It features upright stems that bear clusters of blue to violet bell-shaped flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are usually hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period and attractive foliage.
